## **Accessibility Best Practices**

**Color contrast:**  
- Use high‑contrast combinations (minimum 4.5 : 1 ratio).  
- Favor matte backgrounds and dark text for legibility.  
- Avoid purely color‑based cues; pair colors with icons or labels.

**Font & text:**  
- Choose clean sans‑serif fonts (e.g., Open Sans, Lato, Noto Sans).  
- Minimum 12 pt (14 px) for body text; larger for headers.  
- Maintain generous line spacing (1.4–1.6 × font size).  
- Left‑align text; avoid justified blocks.

**Alt‑text for images & buttons:**  
- Describe content and purpose briefly (“Download free guide on safe, calm crisis communication — not clinical advice”).  
- Keep under 125 characters when possible.  
- For decorative elements, mark as presentation‑only.

**Navigation & layout:**  
- Ensure keyboard navigation works for all interactive items.  
- Provide clear visual focus indicators (e.g., outline or highlight).  
- Add subtitles or captions to any audio or video materials.

**Testing:**  
- Review materials with built‑in accessibility checkers.  
- Solicit feedback from users of assistive devices to verify real‑world clarity.
